ai.summary: A short, easy 2 km hike around Badbury Hill Fort and Badbury Clump in the UK. Suitable for beginners and families, the route follows grassy paths past ancient hill fort remains and offers countryside views.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly grassy, well-defined paths with occasional uneven patches around the hill fort. Some gentle ascents and descents; surfaces can be slippery when wet.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy footwear and watch for uneven ground near earthworks. Check weather and carry rain gear; paths can be muddy. Stay on marked paths and respect the site. Bring water, sun protection in summer, and a charged phone or map for navigation.
recommended_gear: Map or offline map / charged phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn; visits in winter are possible but can be muddy and daylight hours are shorter.

seo.title: Badbury Hill Fort & Badbury Clump – Easy 2 km Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore an easy 2 km hike around Badbury Hill Fort and Badbury Clump in the UK. Gentle grassy paths, historic earthworks, and countryside views—perfect for beginners and families.
